result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M Wilke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License (3rd+ w/in 3yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Cash bond applied and Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on August 1, 2022

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph M Wilke

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

1:04 PM Defendant Joseph M Wilke appeared by video.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by video for Joseph M Wilke. 
21CM162 and 22CM31 tracking together:
Atty Frank states that 22CM31 is ready to go but the other case is not resolved yet.  Atty Juech agrees.
Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Atty Juech states plea agreement to Count 2.  Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Frank agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 2 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Frank makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Count 2:  Pay $100 + costs = $579.00
Submit DNA sample within 60 days and pay surcharge 
Cash bond to be applied
Payment Plan for the balance:  $50.00/month commencing on August 1, 2022

Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in

21CM162 will be set for Jury Trial

3:44 PM . Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph M Wilke appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by video for Joseph M Wilke. 
21CM162 and 22CM31 tracking together:
Atty Frank asks for a plea to be set on 21CM162.  

BY THE COURT:  Set for plea on 21CM162
Plea hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea hearing on June 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:16 PM Defendant Joseph M Wilke appeared by video.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by video for Joseph M Wilke. 
2021CM000162 & 22CM31 tracking:
Atty Frank has had discussions; the newer matter is resolved.  The 21CM162 has an offer with an assessment that has to be done first. Atty Juech responds.
Atty Frank asks for 60 days.

BY THE COURT:  Set plea/sentencing
Status hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on June 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
for Leave to File Additional Motions

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on April 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:17 AM Defendant Joseph M Wilke appeared by video means with Attorney Ryan T. Frank. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Frank received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Atty Frank enters Not Guilty plea to all counts.  Status hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

03:22 PM Defendant Joseph M Wilke appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant qualifies for Public Defender and will be appointing Atty Ryan Frank.
  Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.

Atty Juech requests a $100 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz makes bail arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $100 Cash bond with conditions:
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license  Initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
